Title: Turkey’s Botas signs 10-year LNG supply deal with Shell; deliveries start in 2027
Description: Turkey’s oil and gas distributor and trader Botas has signed a long-term agreement to buy up to about 4 billion m3 of gas a year from Shell’s US and global portfolio, with deliveries starting in 2027.
Author: CK

Title: Bulgargaz seeks five LNG cargoes for delivery to Alexandroupolis from October to February 2025
Description: Bulgarian natural gas distributor Bulgargaz is seeking five LNG cargoes through three tenders for delivery to the 4 mtpa Alexandroupolis floating storage regasification unit-based LNG import terminal in Greece up to February 2025. It seeks a delivery in early October for its first cargo.
Author: CK

Title: Sanctioned Everest Energy LNG tanker transfers Arctic LNG 2 cargo to Saam FSU
Description: Russia has achieved an LNG-sanctions-flouting trifecta in one fell swoop, with the recently sanctioned Everest Energy LNG tanker discharging its cargo from the sanctioned Arctic LNG 2 cargo through a ship-to-ship transfer to the 354,000 m3 Saam floating storage unit near Murmansk. This marks the first transhipment activity for the also-sanctioned Saam and the start of its involvement in Russia’s dark fleet activity.
Author: CK

Title: China’s Huaying LNG terminal to receive commissioning cargo in early September
Description: China’s new 6 mtpa 6 mtpa Huaying LNG terminal in China’s southern province of Guangdong is scheduled to receive its first LNG cargo in early September, with it expected to kick off the start of commissioning operations at the terminal.
Author: CK

Title: LNG commissioning cargo yet to unload at Plaquemines; FERC seeks more information from Venture Global
Description: The 174,000 m3 Qogir LNG tanker, carrying the first LNG cargo to commission the 20 mtpa Plaquemines LNG plant in Louisiana, continues to wait to discharge its cargo a week after its arrival as project developer Venture Global has yet to satisfy the Federal Energy Regulatory Commission's requirements.
Author: CK

Title: LNG Alliance signs initial deal to supply Oman’s OQ Trading from Amigo LNG in Mexico
Description: Singapore-based LNG project developer LNG Alliance has signed an initial agreement to supply LNG from its proposed 7.8 mtpa Amigo LNG facility in Sonora, Mexico, to the trading arm of Oman’s state-owned energy trading firm, OQ Trading.
Author: CK
